kernfrasen: The LORD goes forth like a soldier
like a warrior he stirs up his fury
faith becomes a drug of serenity
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: CULTURE IS A SEDATIVE; FAITH IS REVITALIZATION

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The old, old story becomes the new, new song.

cognitieve_implicaties: Faith is an active, audible performance rather than a private thought.
theologische_implicaties: God's past actions (story) provide the vocabulary for present hope (song).
ethische_implicaties: The believer must speak out against the status quo.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May reduce complex theology to emotional expression or 'vibe'.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Brueggemann revitalizes the 'old story' cliché by mapping it to the physical act of defiant singing.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a tight mapping between the 'Old Story' (Memory) and the 'New Song' (Action).

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The shift from military violence to therapeutic rejection is abrupt.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A warrior destroys; a therapist (even a non-cuddly one) heals.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The singing is presented as the 'vibrational' cause of the physical earthquake, blending art and power.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'dead' metaphor of 'The Old, Old Story' and makes it a prerequisite for 'New Songs'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The old, old story becomes the new, new song.

risicos.beschrijving: The use of 'Warrior' and 'Soldier' for God can be literalized into holy war ideologies.
risicos.voorbeeld: The LORD goes forth like a soldier... he shows himself mighty against his foes.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may adopt a triumphalist or aggressive posture toward 'enemies'.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A 'Mono-culture' of numbness and consumerism (Egypt/Rome/Modern US).
sub_worlds: The prison cell of Paul and Silas
The edge of the Red Sea with Miriam

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates a sense of historical continuity.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeatedly linking God to the breaking of chains and prison doors.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Explicit rejection of the 'nice uncle' image.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as a Soldier/Warrior for justice.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly fits an ordination (Robert Williamson) by defining the 'Teacher' as the guardian of the 'Story'.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'SONG AS DEFIANCE' metaphor. It effectively uses the 'MEDICAL' domain to diagnose cultural malaise (numbness/narcotics) and the 'MILITARY/JOURNEY' domain to prescribe the cure (emancipation).

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Risk of being seen as purely violent.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'Warrior' source by emphasizing the 'weapons' are songs and truth.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The warrior whose only sword is a song of justice.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Link the economic exhaustion of the rat race more clearly to the political oppression of the state.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If faith is a song, those who are tone-deaf or mute are excluded.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that 'singing' is a metaphor for any courageous public act.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To build on the 'foundations of the prison' being shaken.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The structure of the Kingdom vs the structure of Empire.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to turn abstract doctrine into visceral, embodied resistance.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT shows the 'song' isn't just a pretty addition, but the cognitive frame for how the prisoners understood their reality.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Focuses on the conceptual mapping of 'Story to Song' rather than just the learning styles of the warden or Paul.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals how Brueggemann uses 'Container' metaphors (prison, Egypt, rat-race) to set up the need for 'Path' metaphors (Exodus, homecoming).

appendices.notities: Sermon delivered at Clemson Presbyterian Church, 2011.
